Package org.neo4j.io.fs

Class SelectiveFileSystemAbstraction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.io.fs.SelectiveFileSystemAbstraction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, FileSystemAbstraction
    public class SelectiveFileSystemAbstraction
extends Object
implements FileSystemAbstraction
    Allows you to select different file system behaviour for one file and a different file system behaviour for everyone else e.g. Adversarial behaviour for the file under tests and normal behaviour for all other files.

      • streamFilesRecursive

        public Stream<FileHandle> streamFilesRecursive​(Path directory)
                                        throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystemAbstraction
        Return a stream of file handles for every file in the given directory, and its sub-directories.

        Alternatively, if the Path given as an argument refers to a file instead of a directory, then a stream will be returned with a file handle for just that file.

        The stream is based on a snapshot of the file tree, so changes made to the tree using the returned file handles will not be reflected in the stream.

        No directories will be returned. Only files. If a file handle ends up leaving a directory empty through a rename or a delete, then the empty directory will automatically be deleted as well. Likewise, if a file is moved to a path where not all of the directories in the path exists, then those missing directories will be created prior to the file rename.

        Specified by:
        streamFilesRecursive in interface FileSystemAbstraction
        Parameters:
        directory - The base directory to start streaming files from, or the specific individual file to stream.
        Returns:
        A stream of all files in the tree.
        Throws:
        NoSuchFileException - If the given base directory or file does not exists.
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs, possibly with the canonicalisation of the paths.

      • getFileDescriptor

        public int getFileDescriptor​(StoreChannel channel)
        Description copied from interface: FileSystemAbstraction
        Get underlying store channel file descriptor.
        Specified by:
        getFileDescriptor in interface FileSystemAbstraction
        Parameters:
        channel - channel to get descriptor from
        Returns:
